## Installation

<Tabs items={['pnpm', 'npm', 'yarn']}>
  <Tab value="pnpm">
    ```bash
    pnpm add @cbnsndwch/library-name
    ```
  </Tab>
  <Tab value="npm">
    ```bash
    npm install @cbnsndwch/library-name
    ```
  </Tab>
  <Tab value="yarn">
    ```bash
    yarn add @cbnsndwch/library-name
    ```
  </Tab>
</Tabs>

### Peer Dependencies

List any required peer dependencies:

```json
{
  "peerDependencies": {
    "@rocicorp/zero": "^0.x.x",
    "other-dependency": "^1.x.x"
  }
}
```

## Quick Start

A minimal working example to get users started quickly:

<Steps>

### Install the library

```bash
pnpm add @cbnsndwch/library-name
```

### Configure your project

```typescript
import { MainClass } from '@cbnsndwch/library-name';

// Basic configuration
const instance = new MainClass({
  option1: 'value1',
  option2: 'value2',
});
```

### Use it in your application

```typescript
// Example usage
const result = await instance.doSomething();
console.log(result);
```

</Steps>

## Configuration

Detailed explanation of configuration options.

### Configuration Options

#### `option1`

- **Type**: `string`
- **Required**: Yes
- **Default**: None

Description of what this option does and when you'd use it.

```typescript
{
  option1: 'example-value'
}
```

#### `option2`

- **Type**: `number | string`
- **Required**: No
- **Default**: `100`

Description of this option with examples of different values.

```typescript
{
  option2: 200  // numeric value
}
```

### Full Configuration Example

```typescript
import { MainClass, type ConfigOptions } from '@cbnsndwch/library-name';

const config: ConfigOptions = {
  option1: 'value',
  option2: 100,
  // ... other options
};

const instance = new MainClass(config);
```

## Usage Examples

### Basic Usage

Common, straightforward usage patterns:

```typescript
import { MainClass } from '@cbnsndwch/library-name';

const instance = new MainClass({ /* config */ });

// Simple example
const result = await instance.basicMethod();
```

### Advanced Usage

More complex scenarios and patterns:

```typescript
import { MainClass, AdvancedFeature } from '@cbnsndwch/library-name';

// Advanced example with more features
const instance = new MainClass({
  // Advanced configuration
});

const advanced = new AdvancedFeature(instance);
const result = await advanced.complexOperation();
```

### Integration with Zero

How this library integrates with Rocicorp Zero (if applicable):

```typescript
import { Zero } from '@rocicorp/zero';
import { LibraryIntegration } from '@cbnsndwch/library-name';

const zero = new Zero({ /* config */ });
const integration = new LibraryIntegration(zero);

// Use together
await integration.syncData();
```

### Classes

Main class description.


**Methods:**

##### `methodName(param: Type): ReturnType`

Description of what the method does.

**Parameters:**

- `param` (Type) - Description of parameter

**Returns:**

`ReturnType` - Description of return value

**Example:**

```typescript
const result = instance.methodName('value');
```

- `ErrorType` - When this error occurs

### Interfaces

#### `ConfigOptions`

```typescript
interface ConfigOptions {
  option1: string;
  option2?: number;
  option3?: boolean;
}
```

### Types

#### `ResultType`

```typescript
type ResultType = {
  success: boolean;
  data?: unknown;
  error?: string;
};
```

## TypeScript Support

This library is written in TypeScript and provides full type definitions.

### Type Imports

```typescript
import type { ConfigOptions, ResultType } from '@cbnsndwch/library-name';
```

### Generic Types

```typescript
import { GenericClass } from '@cbnsndwch/library-name';

// Using with generics
const typed = new GenericClass<MyType>();
```

## Migration Guide

### Migrating from v1.x to v2.x

If there are breaking changes between versions, document migration steps:

<Steps>

### Update dependencies

```bash
pnpm update @cbnsndwch/library-name
```

### Update imports

```typescript
// Old (v1.x)
import { OldAPI } from '@cbnsndwch/library-name';

// New (v2.x)
import { NewAPI } from '@cbnsndwch/library-name';
```

### Update configuration

Document configuration changes needed.

</Steps>
